t: Amos 5
A Lament and Call to Repentance
Hear*p this word, Israel, this lament I take up concerning you:
“Fallen*pn is Virgin Israel, never*ld to rise again, deserted*ln in her own land, with*ld no one to lift her up.”

This*p is what the Sovereign Lord*s says to Israel: “Your*pn city that marches out a thousand strong will*ld have only a hundred left; your*ln town that marches out a hundred strong will*ld have only ten left.”
This*p is what the Lord*s says to Israel: “Seek*pn me and live;
do*ld not seek Bethel, do*ln not go to Gilgal, do*ld not journey to Beersheba. For*ln Gilgal will surely go into exile, and*ld Bethel will be reduced to nothing.”
Seek*ln the Lord*s and live, or*ld he will sweep through the tribes of Joseph like a fire; it*ln will devour them, and*ld Bethel will have no one to quench it.
There*pn are those who turn justice into bitterness and*ld cast righteousness to the ground.

He*pn who made the Pleiades and Orion, who*ld turns midnight into dawn and*ld darkens day into night, who*ln calls for the waters of the sea and*ld pours them out over the face of the land— the*ld Lord*s is his name.
With*ln a blinding flash he destroys the stronghold and*ld brings the fortified city to ruin.
There*pn are those who hate the one who upholds justice in court and*ld detest the one who tells the truth.

You*pn levy a straw tax on the poor and*ld impose a tax on their grain. Therefore,*ln though you have built stone mansions, you*ld will not live in them; though*ln you have planted lush vineyards, you*ld will not drink their wine.
For*ln I know how many are your offenses and*ld how great your sins. There*pn are those who oppress the innocent and take bribes and*ld deprive the poor of justice in the courts.
Therefore*ln the prudent keep quiet in such times, for*ld the times are evil.
Seek*pn good, not evil, that*ld you may live. Then*ln the Lord*s God Almighty will be with you, just*ld as you say he is.
Hate*ln evil, love good; maintain*ld justice in the courts. Perhaps*ln the Lord*s God Almighty will have mercy on*ld the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore*p this is what the Lord, the Lord*s God Almighty, says: “There*pn will be wailing in all the streets and*ld cries of anguish in every public square. The*ln farmers will be summoned to weep and*ld the mourners to wail.
There*ln will be wailing in all the vineyards, for*ld I will pass through your midst,” says*ld the Lord.*s
The Day of the Lord
Woe*pn to you who long for*ld the day of the Lord!*s Why*ln do you long for the day of the Lord?*s That*ld day will be darkness, not light.
It*ln will be as though a man fled from a lion only*ld to meet a bear, as*ln though he entered his house and*ld rested his hand on the wall only*ld to have a snake bite him.
Will*ln not the day of the Lord*s be darkness, not light— pitch-dark,*ld without a ray of brightness?
“I*pn hate, I despise your religious festivals; your*ld assemblies are a stench to me.
Even*ln though you bring me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I*ld will not accept them. Though*ln you bring choice fellowship offerings, I*ld will have no regard for them.
Away*ln with the noise of your songs! I*ld will not listen to the music of your harps.
But*ln let justice roll on like a river, righteousness*ld like a never-failing stream!
“Did*pn you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty*ld years in the wilderness, people of Israel?
You*ln have lifted up the shrine of your king, the*ld pedestal of your idols, the*ld star of your god— which*ld you made for yourselves.
Therefore*ln I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,” says*ld the Lord,*s whose name is God Almighty.
